text:
Hi!

I try to create an automatic deployment pipeline for HubSpot UI extension built using React JS and I have a question regarding this article: <https://github.com/marketplace/actions/HubSpot-cms-deploy>

Where can I find `dest_dir`  in my project? Can I find it somewhere on HubSpot portal?

Thanks!

Hi everyone,
is it possible to hide HS cookie banner on pages only if they are rendered inside an iframe?
I have a CRM card that is embedding them (it's a React app deployed to the CMS), I want the cookie banner to show on them only if they are served on the web but not when they are rendered inside the CRM card.
I know you can set up a cookie policy that deactivates cookies on specific domains, URL paths ecc. but here domain and paths are not different in the two scenarios, so I can't seemingly target them differently, right?
cc <@U01QVR44MEY> <@U04AQA0QM8E>
its your custom theme name. Go to Design Manager and see what name your theme is in the sidebar.

<@U01QVR44MEY> <@U04AQA0QM8E>
<https://i.imgur.com/lrX4sKT.png>
I am not able to show this date in good format here can anyone let me know how i can send date format , into HubSpot to look properly ,
write now i am sending date in millisecond and its not looking good .
A simple thing you could do is use a query parameter when loading up the iframe, like <https://myiframe.com?iframe=true>
then in the policy you can check for iframe=true
HubSpot date properties use Epoc milliseconds, this is a timeline event though, can you share your timeline event configuration?
Actually I thought about that but didn't see how to set a query param check in here
I see domain and paths options only

Hi everyone! is anyone having issues with the CMS editor? I've found myself today really blocked by this and support can't give me any answer.

I had a look at HubSpot status and everything seems to be OK (<https://status.HubSpot.com/>)
Saw the same. It's back up. Just give it a hard-refresh.
ah bummer, I thought it was like the chat widget
So you could trigger a do not track event if the page is currently being rendered in an iframe
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/events/cookie-banner>
Nevermind. It's down again.
hahaha its been like that all day on my end. I've done a deploy into the main account and I can't figure it out... :shrug:
It just started for me about 5-10 mins ago and going in and out
same here, it's off/on.
Yes! I am also getting this strange error: Request rejected, because isolation group default executor is full.
same issue over here.  weird errors etc.

Oooh I see!
Do you think that a doNotTrack event not only will prevent the HS tracking code from sending any information for the visitor but will prevent the cookie banner from showing as well? Because actually that is what I'm most interested in
Custom code is Node.js or Python so a good starting point would be to learn the basics of one of these languages
Yeah do not track show remove the banner

Hi everyone! I have some problems concerning HubDB and my proxy server. I have cached all of my website pages on a cloudfront server for speed delivery purposes. My use case is the following one: First I update data of a given row and publish it; Then, I have cached the page with the updated data. Sadly, the page is not showing the updated data. My guess is that when the page is cached I still get the older version of it from the HubSpot server. Regardless the delay between updates and caching.
Do you know if there is a way to cache pages and force a newer version of them from HubSpot server?
Bests!
```_hsp.push(['revokeCookieConsent']);```
try this one instead
I just ran a test and looks like that one is the correct one, sorry bro
Nope, still the same to me :confused:
In that same console do you want to try manually running the revoke code?
It's possible that the revoke code is running before the banner is even loaded
```_hsp.push(['revokeCookieConsent']);```
just throw that in the console
It's already there
yeah I was talking about trying to run it in this console just for testing purposes:
Yes
Can we have a short meeting if you have few minute of free time .
do you want to shoot over your config, and if needed we can hop on a call?
It's possible that you just have a small mistake

Hello! I have a custom property on Company that is unique in practice, but it was not created as unique. Is there a way to cleanly replace this property with a unique property that has the same Internal name? (I’m thinking of creating a new unique property, copying over the data, deleting the non-unique property, then creating another new unique property with the desired internal name and copying again)
<@U01QVR44MEY> <https://i.imgur.com/uzCm6xD.png>

This one seems to be the product tour one:
not the survey one
okay will send this one also .

<@U01QVR44MEY>
This one is for product tour

You can format the date just like they do in the example:
```{{#formatDate seen_at}}{{/formatDate}}```

Is there any way to update the screenshots on saved sections when they are saved from the page editor?  When I save them initially the screenshots aren’t working properly and all of them are basically blank.
okay , will do that in the detail template and see

Aaah, sorry :sweat_smile:
Ok, tried that, from the console opened by directly inspecting the iframe, it returns undefined.
I also defined that variable as it's suggested in the docs
really interesting

:HubSpotheart:*Help your fellow HubSpot Developers!*:HubSpotheart:

This Slack lives and breathes by its community. If you're posting a question, take a moment and click around a few channels to see if there are any questions you can help answer. Instant karma!
Yep , it worked fine .

Hmm, I haven’t used CRM cards in this way, so I unfortunately can’t speak with confidence. Are these iframes going to be embedded in a same-origin context, or is it going to be cross-origin?

If it’s cross-origin, I don’t know that there’s a reliable way to detect whether you’re in an iframe. All but the most permissive CSPs are going to deny scripts within cross-origin embeds access to the parent context for security reasons.

If there is, I don’t know it — I’ve always just deleted and re-saved if I get a bad preview. If it’s particularly bad, or a particularly important section, I’ll sometimes add them as theme sections and manually define a screenshot in the front matter.
good deal
So I'm really excited about the possibilities with GraphQL to generate dynamic pages and this demo is great: <https://boilerplate.HubSpotcms.com/recruiting-agency/role-listing>
However I noticed none of the dynamic pages appear in the related <https://boilerplate.HubSpotcms.com/sitemap.xml>
Which is a not ideal for SEO... Do we know if there's a way to get these pages added to the sitemap? If I remember correctly the dynamic pages from HubDB did automatically get added to the sitemap

Hi , all
I want to show logo of my company in contact timeline in the integration , although i have uploaded my company logo in setting of auth setting , but still not showing over here in contact timeline , so do i need to send company url in each consecutive event of contact timeline .
<https://i.imgur.com/mK5xV77.png>
<@U01QVR44MEY>

I suggest reading the docs on this:

```Set up a custom icon
To add visual appeal to your timeline items, you'll want to add a custom icon.

This image file for this icon should:

Have roughly square dimensions
Have a transparent background
Have the content in the center of the icon
Be able to size down to 30x30 pixels
Have a file size of 5MB or less
To set the icon used for timeline events, navigate to Timeline events. Click on the placeholder image or the existing icon to set or update it.

timeline_assets

Once you set the icon(s), they will be shown next to all of the timeline events associated with this application:

timeline_icon.png```
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/timeline>
Thanks , got the reference from documentation .
problem got solved

Yes, it's a same-origin context, basically it's the same app that is deployed to the CMS and served on the web for clients, now it'll be served via CRM card for backoffice users on HS.
Apparently there's no way to interact with the cookie banner in that iframe, so I ended up doing the ol' thing: hiding it with CSS :sweat_smile:
